tweets.text: The second phase of the #Cowes scheme will be delivered in spring 2021 where we will improve the resilience of individual residential properties by fitting measures such as flood doors.

Today we ran a press briefing alongside @metoffice on flood prospects this winter. Signals of a wetter than average Jan - Feb so now’s the time to check your flood risk and sign up to our free flood warnings here https://t.co/gfaL38C2kU https://t.co/QJfsnbC3EB

We’re putting up flood barriers today in Frankwell (#Shrewsbury), #Hereford and #Bewdley. Are you #floodaware ? Sign up for alerts here 
https://t.co/hquuoBs8hF https://t.co/plRYE9aMbU

More fantastic work from our #StaffsSUNRISE project! Transforming the Trent into a more diverse and dynamic habitat for wildlife. 
@StaffsUni @EnvAgencyMids @WildTroutTrust @CraigBennett3 https://t.co/dP3LBMY7NU

Community is the heart of our £40m Radcliffe & Redvales Flood Scheme & this week, our project team, @BAMNuttall @BuryCouncil have embraced the spirit of giving by ensuring local children & families in need will get a #Christmas to remember this year  ⬇️

https://t.co/X12BporwXP https://t.co/DJf3kffPJA

tweets.text: This stretch of the river Lee through Tottenham Marshes is completely disgusting. Breaks my heart to see moorhens, ducks and coots scrambling over this filth. @georgiaes @XRMerton @CarolineRussell @rosamund_ElsFdn @StopTheRebuild For the 12 months at #SLWP Beddington Incinerator🏭 from Dec 2019 to Nov 2020 we saw 13 @EnvAgency permit breaches!

☠️ 2 Dec CO
☠️ 20 Dec CO
☠️ 30 Dec CO
☠️ 28 Feb SO2
☠️ 24 May VOC
☠️ 21 Jun VOC
☠️ 9 Aug VOC
☠️ 16 Aug VOC
☠️ 4 Oct CO
☠️ 18 Oct VOC
☠️ 14 Nov VOC x2
☠️ 24 Nov SO2 https://t.co/YLdPZz2YXh

Thanks to the funders of our Hidden Heritage Secret Streams project. Re-writing the years activity plan was daunting, but we kept people engaged with natural heritage in loads of different ways @HeritageFundM_E @EnvAgencyYNE @YorkshireWater @CoalfieldsRegen @ThirlwallAssoc https://t.co/0FAygl2F9h

Really great news at the end of a tough year to have Lucy and @MoretonBack1 joining the @EnvAgency executive directors team. These are crucial roles in challenging times, but lots to look forward to in 2021. https://t.co/f4w8A75Qtg https://t.co/rfNq85eV07

It's our last working day before we take a break, and we'd like to say "Thank You and Merry Christmas" to everyone that has supported us this year. 2020 has been a team effort and we've deffo found a few positives along the way. 

This could end up being a bit of a thread!

The #BostonBarrier is the first @EnvAgency project which retrospectively looked at @GlobalGoalsUN. We can evidence achievements against all 17 #GlobalGoals & this work is now used as a benchmark within the EA for all future major projects.

📽️Watch as @johncurtinEA explains more: https://t.co/4Kxnw84SZX

This is fantastic news for the town of #Boston. Congrats to Adam and the whole @BostonBarrierEA and @EnvAgency team. The community of more than 13000 properties are better protected from tidal flooding tonight.. This is future resilient engineering at its very best. 😁 https://t.co/GeDbWwI6N8

tweets.text: @fishfacejohnny @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Yes, he should have been aware it was a protected section of the river requiring permissions and permits to do works on. @MarkGale @XRMerton @CarolineRussell @rosamund_ElsFdn @StopTheRebuild More NO2 & more particulates - the pollutants that killed little Ella. Last year, the UK's 39 reporting incinerators recorded 127 pollution breaches. 5 plants had more than 10 breaches each. Authorities must wake up.
We can’t ignore this issue any longer https://t.co/1zisMOMNNP

#Chub are often found in the same stretches of river as Barbel. They live up to10 years and like to feed on surface prey including invertebrates, crane-fly & spiders.

Read more:https://t.co/KprLu3MmUX

Due to increased river levels in York the Foss Barrier has been lowered. It’s job is to stop the dominant river, the Ouse, backing up the Foss and increasing flood risk. Powerful pumps push the Foss water into a culvert so it can flow into the Ouse. https://t.co/PuVgYqJzH2

@BrehenyCivils are making great progress in the works for the Little River Salmon Counter for the @EnvAgency. https://t.co/L3e5dIBQ3M

tweets.text:
@MertonTV @hanna_zuchowska @ViridorUK - Concerns over @EnvAgency & @ViridorUK plans to increase capacity by 15% at the incinerator by both committee members, residents & attending cllr.
- Contracts and Procurement details held in secret.
A reminder that Hylton Road #Worcester is now closed for the installation of flood pumps https://t.co/gy0853uQz2

⚠️ FLOOD ALERTS ⚠️

Flood Alerts have been issued for the River Severn & Upper Teme in #Shropshire, more rain is expected tomorrow with minor flooding expected on the Severn over the weekend & into next week. I'll keep you up to date or visit the @EnvAgency for more info. https://t.co/txnHLD9e23

#TeamEA are working hard with partner organisations to return Black Potts Weir to full service following essential maintenance this winter. A great example of the @EnvAgency 's collaborative delivery framework in action! I look forward to my visit in January to see its progress. https://t.co/tEYNLabYdJ

10 large woody debris features installed across Thornsgill Beck to slow the flow and push water onto the floodplain in storms. Excited to monitor the features to see impact on downstream flood peak. Partnership project with @ForestryEngland @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/uzNrgbrda8
#befloodready everyone! @BeFloodReady @EnvAgencySW @DevComsTogether @CwllCFloodForum https://t.co/4pXefPa4vv
@xrunnerwill @DCfieldteamsEA @EnvAgencySW Great job👍 and enjoying seeing all your gauging station pics Will.  Looks like some of your newly refurbed stations might see a bit of action soon! 🌧️
@fbuner @timthefruit @Feargal_Sharkey Simple answer :The EA @EnvAgency  @JamesBevanEA  @EmmaHowardBoyd are not fit for purpose and even cover for officers who tell lies.  Ie Quine in Tewkesbury.

Great day out today. Catching up with @DCfieldteamsEA @EnvAgencySW at Puslinch where the overhaul of the gauging station is nearly complete. And then some core maintenance of local gauges ahead of more bad weather tomorrow. Love the walk into Carnwood on the River Plym https://t.co/QJSNnTc27J

tweets.text: Overnight & into tomorrow we're expecting heavy rain to fall onto high ground in Devon & Cornwall.  On already wet catchments this will cause fast run off into the rivers & they will rise quickly accordingly.  Keep up to date with our flood warnings here:  https://t.co/RSc51Fqxgs https://t.co/Z6b4ZQhuee
